channel.title: Letters from Edinburgh on The Outsider's Journey
channel.description: Recent content in Letters from Edinburgh on The Outsider's Journey

item.title: Goodbye Edinburgh, Hello Oldenburg
item.description: This is the beginning of a new series of letters I have sent home. It starts three months after my last letter from Edinburgh when I was about to leave for India.

item.title: Reflections on God 6: Radical Atheism
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Radical Atheism After almost a year of intense email exchanges about god with my friend in Sydney, I went to Edinburgh for my Masters in Neuroscience.

item.title: LfE 27: Home
item.description: 22/08/2010 Hello everyone ðŸ™‚ I hope everything is going well with all of you. This is the final mail I’ll send from Edinburgh to all of you because my magical and memorable year has come to an end.

item.title: LfE 26: Amsterdam and realisation of love
item.description: 11/07/2010 Hello I write less and less often nowadays mainly because I’m more busy but also because theres more of the same type of things happening.

item.title: LfE 25: Swift time
item.description: 21/05/2010 Hello! Looks like it really has been a month since I last wrote! And what a busy month it’s been! Various assignments, deadlines, work with project and otherwise, workshops on new software, just so much…of everything has happened!

item.title: LfE 24: Volcano Sunset
item.description: 20/04/2010   Hello, As you all probably know, the Iceland Volcano continues to erupt disrupting flights all over northern Europe. My flatmate who was supposed to go to Germany for part of her PhD has been grounded here.

item.title: LfE 23: Spring in full swing
item.description: 05/04/2010 Hello everyone, We passed the Equinox on the 21st of March. We celebrated and welcomed spring in full swing. Daffodils now grow where the White and purple flowers did.

item.title: LfE 22: To the new apartment
item.description: 12/03/2010 Hi So the shift happened a week ago. The new house is well set now and quite nice. I have assimilated the neighbourhood and cognitively accepted my surroundings.

item.title: LfE 21: Season of Lifeâ€¦ Under my Skin
item.description: 03/03/2010 Hello everyone, I’m halfway through my stay here in Edinburgh and every day brings me closer to the day I can come back home to Bangalore and hug my family.

item.title: LfE 20: Dundee
item.description: 25/02/2010 I went to Dundee for a training session for the postgrad review job that I have. It snow-stormed in the morning. Wild winds. Train was good.

item.title: LfE 19: Work and Tea
item.description: 22/02/2010 Hello everyone, It’s been a long time since I last wrote, partly because I’ve not been doing too much of new things – the project develops, and software glitches occur daily that I patiently overcome.

item.title: LfE 18: Activities and work place
item.description: 07/02/2010 Hello ðŸ™‚ It snowed one morning unexpectedly. It is Feb so I thought all that weather is over. But it lasted an hour and melted within the next two days.

item.title: LfE 17: Brain Scan
item.description: 26/01/2010 Hello, It feels like a long time since I wrote. My project is now developing and I have a better clue about what it is about.

item.title: LfE 16: Back in Edinburgh
item.description: 12/01/2010 Hi everyone, Hope you all had a good holiday. I’m back in Edinburgh, this familiar and beautiful city. I actually have developed a kind of loyalty to it.

item.title: LfE 15: A visit to Oxford and Thoughts in Slough
item.description: 29/12/2009 Hello ðŸ™‚ I have been in Slough, a town near London, for around two weeks now. It has been restful to spend time with family, watch movies, go shopping etc.

item.title: LfE 14: Traveling to Slough
item.description: 15/12/2009 Hello everyone! Hope this letter finds you all in good health. My adventures are more mobile now. I’m on the train to Slough to visit family for the holidays.

item.title: LfE 13: The last day and the Bicycle story
item.description: 06/12/2009 Hello! It’s nearly noon on this bright sunshiny Sunday. The temperature is 8 Degrees Celsius. Last night it hit an unusual 9 degrees! I had planned to pull out my gloves only after December started but I remember November days being colder than this!

item.title: LfE 12: Weekend activities
item.description: 29/11/2009 Hello everyone ðŸ™‚ It’s a Sunday. Four degrees celsius as I write, and cloudy. A bunch of us friends are going to the German market today on Princes Street.

item.title: LfE 11: Glasgow and Animal Handling
item.description: 18/11/2009 Hello everyone! This time I have more to say ðŸ™‚ I have a laptop now. Acer Aspire…metallic midnight blue…itâ€™s my first ever so I’m very attached, and loving to it.

item.title: LfE 10: Enormous Work Load and Frost
item.description: 09/11/20009 Hi! Itâ€™s me again ðŸ™‚ All is well with me and I hope you are all equally well. The pressure in Uni to get work done has suddenly risen exponentially and the weather is getting colder by the day.

item.title: LfE 9: Halloween and the True Colours of the Weather
item.description: 01/11/2009 Hello everyone! My cough is completely gone. It took its own time and I waited patiently ðŸ™‚ Last night was Halloween. We were out all night partying.

item.title: LfE 8: Gifford Lectures and Indian Festivities
item.description: 23/10/2009 Greetings! I recover from a cough as I write this. The reason for the long silence is the fever I had last weekend. I know you kind-hearted people are starting to worry already!

item.title: LfE 7: No news isâ€¦
item.description: 12/10/2009 Hello!! Itâ€™s been a while it seems since my last update. All is well on this side of the world. I am cocooned in academic life and donâ€™t hear the news very often.

item.title: LfE 6: Classes are Intense
item.description: 04/10/2009 Hello everyone! The weather this week albeit two days in the middle has been pleasant with sunny blue skies. This is most unexpected in Edinburgh but a joy to us although the wind can be a real bully while walking; pushing us forward and backward with no warning!

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh (LfE) 5: Settled and Rocking!
item.description: **28/09/2009 JANANI IS SETTLED AND ROCKING!** Hello everyone! I’m well and I hope you are all in a well too :):) (Sorry, I had to crack that ðŸ™‚ )

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh: 4
item.description: **22/09/2009 EDINBURGH PART 4: ZAPPED** Hi! I had my first classes today so after an all-girls Birthday party (of our new American friend) last night with yum brownies, I organised my things for today and slept as early as possible.

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh: 3
item.description: **19/09/2009 THE BEGINNING: PART 3** Hello all! It has been nearly 10 days since I got here. Freshersâ€™ week was very fun! I went for lots of cool events where we got to meet people from all sorts of fields from genomics to international politics and everything in between!

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh: 2
item.description: **13/09/2009 THE BEGINNING: PART 2** Hello! I just got back from a great time at three events. I climbed Arthurâ€™s Seat and made a friend (Greek) who’s about to start studying Bachelors of Computer science and met a Londoner who studies Geology.

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh: 1
item.description: In the posts that follow this, will be the letters I wrote to family and friends when I was in Edinburgh for my MSc in Neuroscience.
